item.title: Helping
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

  1. you do need a router
  2. go to start, open cmd. Write “ipconfig” go to Default Gateway, write that default gateway in another tab/browser
  3. portforward.com will help with the rest

Read full topic

item.title: Helping
item.dc:creator: @kicker862 kicker862
item.description:
@kicker862 wrote:

Wanna help me port forward?
I have a problem…
I posted it on yahoo answers and no one helped so I’m reposting it here.
I’m trying to host runescape private servers but I need to port forward but everytime I try it doesn’t work.
Do I have to have a router to be able to let people to connect without using hamachi?
Does it not work cause I have wireless internet?
Its like verizons usb modem but a different network.
Why can’t I port forward?
If I do need a router to port forward, do I have to be able to get onto my routers setup page? Because none of those ip addresses I type in ever work. 192.168.0.1 192.168.2.1 etc…
People say using utorrent works for port forwarding.
But I followed the guides and no one could connect through my no-ip.
Any suggestions?
I get my no-ip.
I follow the torrent guides.
I change my client.java files for my client and source to have my no-ip as the default so people don’t have to keep changing the default one.
Oh and I posted this from my phone so if you plan on getting on team viewer ill do it in like an hour or so. I just want to know what I’m doing wrong right now.

Read full topic
